title: 110_hr6988
content: The "Wildlife Penning Prohibition Act" prohibits the use of wildlife in dog training activities where coyotes, foxes, or other wildlife are pursued, harassed, or killed within an enclosure. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit certain acts related to wildlife, including redesignating paragraphs and subsections within the act. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit various activities involving wildlife, such as importing, exporting, and selling prohibited species in interstate or foreign commerce. The amendments also involve redesignating paragraphs and subsections within the act. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 prohibit activities involving wildlife, including importing, exporting, and selling prohibited species. The amendments also involve redesignating paragraphs and subsections within the act, such as replacing references to "animals listed in section 2(g)" with "prohibited wildlife species" in certain clauses. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 involve redesignating paragraphs and subsections within the act, including changes to civil penalties for violations. The Lacey Act Amendments of 1981 involve redesignating paragraphs and subsections within the act, including changes to civil penalties for violations. Amendments include inserting subsections (d) or (e) of section 3 and correcting prior amendments related to subsection 3(b). SEC. 4 of the Captive Wildlife Safety Act amends Section 3 by removing subsection (b) and adjusting the wording in subsection (a).
